title: Days Gone developer starts work on new PlayStation 5 game
text:
Days Gone – is there a sequel coming to PS5?

Sony Bend Studio has begun development of a new project, but is it Days Gone 2, a new Syphon Filter, or something else?

There’s been no official announcement, but a developer at Bend Studio has updated their LinkedIn profile to say that he is ‘now involved in the pre-production planning for our next title’.

Developers are always saying things on LinkedIn while forgetting that everyone else can see them, so there doesn’t seem much reason not to take his statement at face value.

Given the time frames involved (if they’re only just starting now it’d be at least two or three years till it’s finished) it’s inconceivable the game wouldn’t be a PlayStation 5 title, but there’s no clue as to what exactly it might be.

The obvious guess is Days Gone 2, as despite being one of the least critically acclaimed Sony exclusives the first Days Gone sold very well and left plenty of story potential for a sequel.

Prior to Days Gone, Bend Studio were best known for the Syphon Filter series of stealth action games, which they’ve often threatened to make a new entry in. Although the last was PSP game Logan’s Shadow in 2007.

They’ve also worked on a couple of portable Uncharted spin-offs, but it would certainly be a surprise if they were the ones to follow-up the end of an era finale to Uncharted 4.

Perhaps the most important point is simply that whatever they are working on won’t be out for a long while, so there’ll be no Bend Studio game for the PlayStation 5’s launch. Unless they do a remaster of Days Gone that is…
